primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must perform specific moral and ascetic actions to secure God's favor and presence.

tekstueel_bewijs: If you see to it that your soul doesn’t remain weighed down

object.identificatie: God's favor, hearing of prayers, and entry into the Kingdom
tekstueel_bewijs: your fasts will be most acceptable to God
God may receive you into his kingdom

zender.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / God as Lawgiver
tekstueel_bewijs: the fasting which pleases the Most High
you’ll acquire a stronger title to God’s favor
you’ll sense that God is favorably disposed toward you
your soul may then receive the help of your sanctified body
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Object/Rewarder, not the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the Sender of the mandate, not the indwelling power.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are internal passions that the Subject is assumed to have the power to 'smother' or 'extinguish' through willpower.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The social-ethical program of helping the poor as a means to the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical program is a 'sub-task' required to achieve the primary goal of pleasing God. Charity is instrumentalized.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Sanctified Body → The Believer ← Internal Passions

voorbeelden_mens_subject: You must also renounce your vices
you can be confident of obtaining

voorbeelden: you must also renounce your vices
spirit of piety that moves you
true understanding of the virtue of religion
your soul may then receive the help of your sanctified body

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer already possesses the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to change; it only provides the 'Devoir' (Obligation) and 'Savoir' (Knowledge).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Niet-S1 (Hypocrisy) to S1 (Virtue) via human effort.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the Subject's performance of good works.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. God is described as 'positively filled with disgust'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a classic example of 'If-Then' theology. Grace is the reward for performance, not the source of it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Your fasts will please him only if you cleanse your conscience.
you can be confident of obtaining whatever you pray for.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Isaiah's description of the 'true faster' is used as a direct behavioral template.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who unties the thongs of the yoke (Christ as the true Subject of Isaiah 58).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety (if they fail) or Pride (if they succeed).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagian anthropology; the human will is the hinge of salvation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a moral manifesto, but theologically incoherent regarding the Gospel.
spanning_punten: The 'Amen' and 'Through Christ' at the end clash with the merit-based logic of the body.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: you’ll acquire a stronger title to God’s favor

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Devoir' (reprimand) but not the 'Pouvoir'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a series of 'vices' to be cut out, rather than a condition of death.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (by performing works to enter the kingdom).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Contract Narrative' where the human is the Subject and God is the Paymaster.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the subject of 'cleansing', 'renouncing', and 'obtaining'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who cleanses the heart so that the believer can fast in gratitude.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Force your heart to abstain,' use 'Christ has broken the power of sin in your heart, so that you are now free to abstain.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the Hero of their own sanctification.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the Receiver of God's mercy (the 'oppressed' in Isaiah 58).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with the one being freed by God, not the one doing the freeing.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on Pouvoir (God's power given to the weak).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Passions are treated as easily conquerable.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Acknowledge sin as a power we cannot break ourselves.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is weak, the Savior is unnecessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Program 2) is the condition for Soteriology (Program 1).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but structurally Pelagian. To move toward grace, the preacher must make God the Subject of the transformation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is persuasive and uses scripture well; semiotically, it is a works-righteousness engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Isaiah 58 often misses that God is the ultimate Liberator; Greimas exposes this by looking at actantial roles.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Christ' is only a tag at the end, not an actant in the story's engine.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'language' of the Spirit but the 'logic' of the ladder.
